docs.summary:
Radio button groups are used for selecting one of a number of
 options. Radio button groups consist of a list of [options](#Option). Each
 [option](#Option) contains a label, which is what the user sees, and a
 value, which is what is used in code and stored in you collections.

srcDocs.summary:
Radio button groups are used for selecting one of a number of
 options. Radio button groups consist of a list of [options](#Option). Each
 [option](#Option) contains a label, which is what the user sees, and a
 value, which is what is used in code and stored in you collections.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the options in a radio button group.
description: Setting the `options` property sets all the [options](#Option)
available to a user.
Set `options` to an empty array (`[]`) to remove the current radio button group options.
Getting the `options` property returns the current
list of [options](#Option) available to a user.
You cannot modify the data array in-place. To add, change, or remove
individual radio button options:
1. Store the value of the `options` property in a variable.
1. Make changes to the options array.
1. Reset the `options` property with the modified array.

examples.title: Get the list of options and the first option's label and value from a radio button group
Set the list of options for a radio button group
Add an option to a radio button group

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets the options in a radio button group.
description: Setting the `options` property sets all the [options](#Option)
available to a user.
Set `options` to an empty array (`[]`) to remove the current radio button group options.
Getting the `options` property returns the current
list of [options](#Option) available to a user.
You cannot modify the data array in-place. To add, change, or remove
individual radio button options:
1. Store the value of the `options` property in a variable.
1. Make changes to the options array.
1. Reset the `options` property with the modified array.

examples.title: Get the list of options and the first option's label and value from a radio button group
Set the list of options for a radio button group
Add an option to a radio button group

docs.summary: Sets or gets the index of the selected option.
description: Setting the `selectedIndex` property sets the option at
that index to be the selected option. To set one of the options to be
selected, set the `selectedIndex` property to an index between `0` and
`options.length - 1`.
To reset the radio button group to have no option
selected, set the `selectedIndex` property to `undefined`.
Getting the `selectedIndex` property returns the index of
the currently selected option. If no value is selected, the
`selectedIndex` property returns `undefined`.

examples.title: Get the index of the selected option
Select the first option by index

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets the index of the selected option.
description: Setting the `selectedIndex` property sets the option at
that index to be the selected option. To set one of the options to be
selected, set the `selectedIndex` property to an index between `0` and
`options.length - 1`.
To reset the radio button group to have no option
selected, set the `selectedIndex` property to `undefined`.
Getting the `selectedIndex` property returns the index of
the currently selected option. If no value is selected, the
`selectedIndex` property returns `undefined`.

examples.title: Get the index of the selected option
Select the first option by index

docs.summary: Sets or gets the value of the selected option.
description: Setting the `value` property sets the [`Option`](#Option)
with that value to be the selected option. You must set the `value`
property to a value that exists in the [`options`](#options) list.
To reset the radio button group to have no option
selected, set the `value` property to `null` or `undefined`.
Getting the `value` property returns the value of
the currently selected option. If no value is selected, the
`value` property returns an empty string.

examples.title: Get the value of the selected option

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets the value of the selected option.
description: Setting the `value` property sets the [`Option`](#Option)
with that value to be the selected option. You must set the `value`
property to a value that exists in the [`options`](#options) list.
To reset the radio button group to have no option
selected, set the `value` property to `null` or `undefined`.
Getting the `value` property returns the value of
the currently selected option. If no value is selected, the
`value` property returns an empty string.

examples.title: Get the value of the selected option

docs.summary: An object used by the `options` property that contains the attributes of a radio button item.

srcDocs.summary: An object used by the `options` property that contains the attributes of a radio button item.

members.name: value
members.docs: The value of the radio button option. This is what you use in code and is what is stored in your collections.

members.name: label
